intro: Lasiandra oxypetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lasiandra, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are usually narrow and lance-shaped. Its flowers are small, white or cream-colored, and are clustered in inflorescences, contributing to its ornamental value. Lasiandra oxypetala is well adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in dry, open habitats.
